channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump's economic approval at new low. And, Congress set to let ACA subsidies expire
item.description: A new NPR poll finds that President Trump's economic approval has hit a new low at 36%. And, Congress has two days to take action on health care subsi...

item.title: From bird droppings to holiday kisses: How we ended up under the mistletoe
item.description: The etymology of mistletoe — a plant with small, oval evergreen leaves and waxy white berries — may strike some as repugnant.

item.title: Thousands of guns are found at crime scenes. What do they tell us?
item.description: A report from the advocacy group Everytown For Gun Safety analyzed data from local police departments on nearly 350,000 guns used in crimes from 2020 ...

item.title: Recent attacks have been 'inspired' by Islamic State. What does that mean?
item.description: A decade ago, the self-proclaimed Islamic State group held vast swaths of territory across Iraq and Syria, but President Trump declared it destroyed i...

item.title: Trump's BBC lawsuit: A botched report, BritBox, and porn
item.description: President Trump's lawsuit alleges that the BBC's fall 2024 documentary was "a brazen attempt" to harm his re-election. The BBC has apologized but reje...

item.title: US accused of using illegal workers at centre processing refugee claims in South Africa
item.description: The seven Kenyans had previously been denied working visas and will now be deported, South Africa says.

item.title: Fallout and the secret of the perfect video game adaptation
item.description: Masterminds behind the classic video game series tell us how they created a successful TV show.

item.title: Venezuela denounces Trump's order for ship blockade as 'warmongering threats'
item.description: It comes a week after the US seized an oil tanker off the country's coast, intensifying pressure on Nicolás Maduro.

item.title: 'It's just a nightmare': Ten-year-old victim's mum speaks at Bondi memorial
item.description: The mother of 10-year-old Matilda, the youngest victim of the Bondi Beach attack, paid tribute to her daughter at a flower memorial on Tuesday evening...

item.title: More than $1M already donated for hero who tackled Bondi Beach gunman
item.description: Ahmed al Ahmed, the Syrian-Australian father who wrestled a shotgun from one of the gunmen attacking a Jewish gathering, is facing a long road to reco...

item.title: Investigators release additional video of possible Brown gunman as search continues
item.description: Authorities are asking the public for any footage they might have of the gunman who fatally shot two students and wounded nine others at Brown Univers...

item.title: What to consider about mortgage rate locks now, according to experts
item.description: Locking in one of today's lower mortgage rates may make sense, experts say, but there are some items to know first.

item.title: U.S. labels Colombian cartel a terror group, opening door to military action
item.description: The U.S. State Department said Clan del Golfo is a "violent and powerful criminal organization" that uses cocaine trafficking to fund violent activiti...

item.title: What are the 'ghost ships' Venezuela is using to evade oil sanctions?
item.description: A tanker seized by the US is believed to be part of a "ghost fleet" used by Venezuela to evade oil sanctions.

item.title: 2 big unions balk at merger creating first U.S. transcontinental railroad
item.description: The proposed $85 billion merger of Union Pacific and Norfolk Southern railroads, which would create the first U.S. transcontinental railroad, has lost...

item.title: Researchers capture video of rare polar bear adoption
item.description: The footage of a bear caring for an adopted cub was captured during the annual polar bear migration along the Western Hudson Bay in Churchill, Manitob...

item.title: Brown mourns the loss of an aspiring doctor and campus leader to the campus attack
Brown University shooting leaves students, community frustrated with official response
